snippet: Hundreds or even thousands of lives are at risk after a major manufacturer suspended production of methotrexate, a treatment for childhood leukemia.
abstract: Methotrexate, crucial medicine to treat childhood leukemia, is in such short supply that hospitals across the country may exhaust their stores within two weeks; supplies of drug have dwindled since Ben Venue Laboratories, one of the nation's largest suppliers, voluntarily suspended operations at its plant.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds or even thousands of lives are at risk after a major manufacturer suspended production of methotrexate, a treatment for childhood leukemia.

headline.seo: Supply of Methotrexate, a Cancer Drug, May Run Out Soon
headline.main: Supply of a Cancer Drug May Run Out Within Weeks
headline.print_headline: Supply of a Cancer Drug May Run Out in Weeks
